website_summaries.verdict: As long as you don't mind not being able to print from a USB flash key, the Dell B1165nfw's healthy array of extra features and quick outbound print cycle make it worthwhile for small offices with wireless access.
pros: The Dell B1165nfw is a dutiful monochrome laser printer that can also act as a standalone scanner, copier, and fax machine
It's cloud-ready with native support for Google Cloud Print, Apple AirPrint, and Dell's own mobile Android application
cons: The printer includes a "starter" cartridge with less-than-average capacity, no upgrades exist for the limited paper tray, and there's no media card reader

customer_reviews.title: Loses Connection
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this printer for almost four years. It does the job and I was satisfied with it in the beginning. For the last year it keeps losing connection and I have to restart. Also it will not wake up from sleep mode when I airprint half the time and I have to physically walk over and push buttons to wake it up. The display is very hard to read and I sometimes use my phone flash light to read it. When it runs out of paper, you cannot just add paper. You have to add paper and open the top assembly and shut it again before it will recognize the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Jane W

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after thorough shopping of competitors, and am happy to have done so. Sleep mode's nicely quiet, but the machine wakes up quickly for printing or copying. Scan and print quality are quite good. Network connection works easily and provides full setup of the printer via its own Web page (use the printer's IP address as the URL). Small gripe: the buttons at upper right are not labeled, and the raised icons on them are the same matte black as the buttons themselves, so you must press the Start button to bet illumination to tell which button is which.
customer_reviews.author: Kong

customer_reviews.title: Fast Printer and Very Good Scanner
customer_reviews.text: So far The Dell B1165nfw Laser Multifunction Monochrome Printer works fine, prints fast, scans are very good. All my computers recognize the device and only one had a problem with the print manager but that was easy to solve with simple workaround. I can definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TestRat

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for the price
customer_reviews.text: The printer is nice and small for a laser printer and fits well on a corner of my desk. The build of the printer seems pretty cheap and flimsy, though, and I won't be surprised if it doesn't last a long time - though given the relatively inexpensive price, perhaps I should not have expected a more robust printer. The printer was pretty easy to install on my Mac, but the tiny, dim LED command screen is a nuisance to try to read.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa H.

customer_reviews.title: I own this printer for about a year now, ...
customer_reviews.text: I own this printer for about a year now, use it very minimal the few days a year I work from home. For no reason I need to keep restarting the printer for it to show up on network or to print. And even then sometimes won;t work. I don't care for DELL printers.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: having problems with wifi doesn't keep the connection long so I use it hard wired to my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: mary mcdoniel

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great if you own iPads or iPhones you can print directly to it it's fast prints a lot of pages the only downside to it is it only prints in black-and-white and staples or OfficeMax do not carry the toner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works well but takes a bit to warm up to print
customer_reviews.author: David Weller

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've used
customer_reviews.text: Unpacking was not difficult but also not easy. I have a mac book pro running mavericks beta. Setup? What setup? I turned the printer on and printed a document from my mac and my ipad instantly just by choosing the printer from a list. Done. Fax? Simple. Scanning? I don't use scanning so I can't comment. Great printer.
customer_reviews.author: e981

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great have one at home & one at the office
customer_reviews.author: Curtis B Coltson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty reasonable price for an all in one machine that is easy to set up & wireless also.
customer_reviews.author: victor harabin

customer_reviews.title: FAX DOESN"T WORK
customer_reviews.text: Can not get the FAX portion of the unit to work! Problem may be in the incoming hardwired phone line! knappngator@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: knappngator

customer_reviews.title: good cheap printer with one bad flaw
customer_reviews.text: I needed copying and scanning. It does this. I am using it at home and did not need large volume printing. The one bad flaw is that there is no bypass for envelopes. I foolishly assumed that all laser printers had this. To do an envelope, one has to remove all the paper and slide the guides together. Even then I have never been able to make even one envelope print straight. Fortunately, we have a second laser printer in the house with an appropriate bypass for envelopes. If I could choose again, I would definitely not buy this one, but would keep looking and probably pay more.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wootton

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy -- Non-stop Headaches
customer_reviews.text: We were delighted to find the Dell B1165nfw all-in-one printer at a reasonable price. It seemed like it would suit all of our b/w printing and copying needs. Unfortunately, this printer has serious problems. It goes into sleep mode every night and the only way to wake it up is to remove the power cord from the rear, wait several seconds, then reattach the power cord. This is hardly convenient. In fact, it is a pain. Imagine having to unplug your printer every day before using it. It is just a headache, especially if one is on another floor and needs to print. Enough said. Save your money, save yourself another headache, and do not buy this Dell product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Abso-dell-utely skip this printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because it is touted by Dell as cloud print ready, but I cannot get it to print from my Chromebook unless I keep a PC or Mac computer also running that is configured with the printer. As other reviewers have commented recently, it doesn't seem to have true cloud print functionality, but rather appears to be limited to what is known as 'classic' cloud print functionality. Unfortunately, Dell does not include any instructions with the printer or on their website on setting the printer up for cloud print use. Calling customer service did not result in any solutions, but rather just long hold times and being transferred to other extensions......and even longer hold times.
customer_reviews.author: Tepozteco

customer_reviews.title: Good printer some moderate downsides
customer_reviews.text: I originally did not like this printer as much as my old workhorse Brother all in one. Over the months where I use this printer exclusively I have grown to like its dependability. Two major downsides of this printer is the poor visibility of the LCD screen that is very dim and hard to read and the relatively higher cost of the toner cartridges vs. the Brother cartridges that last forever. I do like the wireless connectivity of the printer but you do need a good signal from your router or it does lose the connection when I first had it upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: OBXRON

customer_reviews.title: Wireless connection is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer specifically to work with my Del laptop for wireless printing and scanning. The vast majority of the time it will disconnect form my laptop and I will have to trouble shoot reconnecting. I have spent hours on the phone with Dell and the problem has never been resolved as it continues to not be connected to my laptop. Absolute waste of money and time. I will never buy another Dell printer. I have a Brother that works fantastic. I'm going with them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Won't wake up from 'sleep' mode
customer_reviews.text: This printer has a good set of features and a nice price. However, once it goes into 'sleep' mode, it will not wake up again when you submit a print job. You have to power-cycle the printer to get it to wake up. I tried everything Dell tech support suggested. Dell finally exchanged the printer for a different one, but the second one has the exact same problem. This appears to be a basic flaw in the printer. Do not buy this printer, unless you are OK with power cycling it every time you want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: cckweiss

customer_reviews.title: I spent more time trying to reconnect the stupid thing to the network than actually printing to it
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, plastic junk. Frustrating to set up, jams, works inconsistently, can never retain wireless settings. Cartridge runs out after 100 pages, print quality is sub par. I spent more time trying to reconnect the stupid thing to the network than actually printing to it. The tiny control panel is also worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Torme

customer_reviews.title: Good, but NO iOS PRINTING SINCE iOS 8
customer_reviews.text: Works well, except for one important thing: Does not work (December 2014) with iOS 8. The update from 7 to 8 broke something and now it won't print from iPhone/iPad with iOS 8+. Dell still advertises the printer as "AirPrint compatible," which at this point it is not (if they were serious about compatibility, they would have issued a firmware update so re-establish the AirPrint capability.
customer_reviews.author: Zhao Ma

customer_reviews.title: Must be better choices out there.
customer_reviews.text: Have trouble with wireless connection constantly (other printers are fine). Poor quality outprint (from the very beginning). I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Be4me

customer_reviews.title: Dell printers are garbage - don't waste your money on them
customer_reviews.text: Endless wireless problems. Unfixable for even the short term. Last Dell POS I will ever buy. Dell once meant quality; now it means buggy junk.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: 2 or higher so I purchased it few days ago for a really good price. I installed it very easy and is ...
customer_reviews.text: It is advertised that you can print from ipad iphone ios 4.2 or higher so I purchased it few days ago for a really good price. I installed it very easy and is working with my dell laptop, but I can't use it to print from my ipad or iphone 5. I called Dell and find out that this printer is not compatible with ios 8. I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This would be the worst printer I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This would be the worst printer I've ever used. Problem after problem - door wont close, wont communicate with computer, wont print after enters sleep mode (that one was fixed eventually). Just dreadful.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Forget the WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to setup, keeps disappearing from the wifi and has to be setup over and over. Works fine over USB but useless as a WIFI printer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Prints great when it does. I have it wired and over the wifi. But it takes a few hours to make it work. I never had problems w printers b4. No support on dell. Have worked lately.
customer_reviews.author: victor uriarte

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: purchased on sale at dell.com. tray does not hold enough paper. scanner part need replaced after 6 month
customer_reviews.author: bobbye Records

product_meta.title: Dell Computer B1165nfw Wireless Monochrome Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax
product_meta.description: Make your everyday tasks easy with an affordable 4-in-1 multifunction printer and a wide range of convenient, time-saving features.
feature_bullets: Dell Easy Wi-Fi Installer: Gets you up and running quickly with a simple, hassle-free wireless setup process
Nuance  Paper Port 14 software: Helps you create, archive, organize and share high-quality, searchable PDFs.
Print from mobile devices: (Android  and iOS) and from Google Cloud Print .

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars47 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
